summary: SummaryHighlightsSustainable PackagingClinique Pop Lip + Cheek Oil in Black Honey, Pink Honey, and Nude Honey Clinique Pop Lip + Cheek Oil is a two-in-one tinted oil that delivers a dewy pop of color for lips and cheeks. In 3 surprisingly flexible shades.
details: DetailsBenefitsHelps condition lips with a nourishing blend of oils: safflower oil, jojoba oil, olive oil, sunflower seed oil, and castor oil.Soft, tapered applicator delivers the perfect slip of color to lips.Oil formula slips on to cheeks with ease - just swipe and blend into skin with your fingertips.Gives cheeks a sheer wash of color for a natural, dewy blush look.3 Shades: Black Honey, Pink Honey, and first at Ulta, NEW Nude Honey.Iconic Shade Black Honey:Black Honey is famous for its chameleon-like ability to flatter all skin tones yet look different on everyone. The secret is its perfect blend of blue, red, and yellow pigments in a creamy, sheer base that melts into lips, playing up their natural color.Fan-Favorite Pink Honey:Pink Honey is a soft, sheer pink that adds rosy tint to lips and cheeks.First at Ulta, NEW Nude Honey:Nude Honey is the only nude you need. With a perfect mix of warm and cool pigments that blend with your lips for a shade unique to you.Free of: parabens, phthalates.Allergy tested. 100% fragrance free.Key IngredientsNourishing oil blend with safflower oil, jojoba oil, olive oil, sunflower seed oil, and castor oil helps condition lips.Item 2640693How To UseShake well. Apply tinted oil to lips and cheeks. Blend as a blush onto cheek quickly with fingertips. For lips, layer the lip oil over its matching shade of Almost Lipstick for even more impact.IngredientsHydrogenated Polyisobutene, Triisostearyl Citrate, Pentaerythrityl Tetraethylhexanoate, Polyglyceryl-2 Triisostearate, Hydrogenated Polydecene, Ricinus Communis (Castor) Seed Oil, Dipentaerythrityl Tri-Polyhydroxystearate, Carthamus Tinctorius (Safflower) Seed Oil, Olea Europaea (Olive) Fruit Oil, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, Silica, Tocopheryl Acetate, Squalane, Curcuma Longa (Turmeric) Root Extract, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Lauryl Pca, Caprylyl Glycol, Dimethicone, Polysilicone-11, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, [+/- Mica, Titanium Dioxide (Ci 77891), Iron Oxides (Ci 77491), Iron Oxides (Ci 77492), Iron Oxides (Ci 77499), Bismuth Oxychloride (Ci 77163), Carmine (Ci 75470), Manganese Violet (Ci 77742), Orange 5 (Ci 45370), Red 6 (Ci 15850), Red 21 (Ci 45380), Red 27 (Ci 45410), Blue 1 Lake (Ci 42090), Red 7 Lake (Ci 15850), Red 22 Lake (Ci 45380), Red 28 Lake (Ci 45410), Red 30 Lake (Ci 73360), Red 33 Lake (Ci 17200), Yellow 5 Lake (Ci 19140), Yellow 6 Lake (Ci 15985)]Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Shake well. Apply tinted oil to lips and cheeks. Blend as a blush onto cheek quickly with fingertips. For lips, layer the lip oil over its matching shade of Almost Lipstick for even more impact.

reviews.headline: Was hoping for more
reviews.comments: The color is great, however; not as moisturizing as I hoped.

reviews.headline: Not for large pored faces
reviews.comments: Bought both the Black Honey and Nude Honey. Liked it on the lips but I already have the lip gloss and almost lipstick, so wanted it for blush. Did not like. I believe if you had glass like skin, with no visible pores, it would work great. On my not-glassy, large pore (inherited from my dad) skin, it looked blotchy. It sunk into pores and sat on the rest of my skin. Am returning both colors. Would recommend as a lip oil.

reviews.headline: Nice color, thin formula
reviews.comments: I really like the color on this, I have the Almost Lipstick in black honey and wanted something with a glossier finish. But using this on my lips I feel like the formula is just a bit too thin. I think it might be by design since this is designed to use on cheeks as well and the thin formula makes it more blendable, but I don't love that in a lip product

reviews.headline: Pretty color, but sticky and overpriced
reviews.comments: Not for the oily girlies - this is definitely quite sticky, and while I like the color and I have dry skin and like dewiness, not sure its worth it full price - I got it half off but I would not rebuy at full price

reviews.headline: Shine
reviews.comments: More shine than color, but it's nice over a darker lip color.

reviews.headline: Cute color, dried my lips so fast
reviews.comments: Not moisturizing at all.

reviews.headline: Love it!!!!
reviews.comments: It is the best oil that I tried!

reviews.headline: GREASEY!!!!
reviews.comments: This is literally the worst lip product I've ever bought. It's super greasy like you know when you bite into a greasy hamburger that's how I feel with this on my mouth. Returning this ASAP.

reviews.headline: So good
reviews.comments: Love the lip oils and the color is perfect

reviews.headline: Disappointed
reviews.comments: Nude Honey is a beautiful color and it does feel hydrating for all of the 2 seconds it lasts on the lips. Didn't try it as a blush.

reviews.headline: Really Nice!
reviews.comments: The color for the pink honey is subtle. It is easy to apply and blend on the cheeks. For the lips, the application is buttery and smooth to put on and gives a nice sheen. The only problem I have is there's not much of a stopper for the applicator, so you have to rub excess off on the side. Other than that, the product is nice, and i would buy again.

reviews.headline: I have used Black Honey lipsticks for years, this adds a new
reviews.comments: I love the colour, it suits my skin. Colour lasts all day on me and it is not sticky. The bottle looks small in size but suck a small amount is needed it will last for ages. I  make sure I have an extra spare in stock, now I have found this product I would hate to be without.

reviews.headline: The balm version is better
reviews.comments: I wanted to love this product as I have been using the balm version of this. I find the balm version in the tube has better lasting power than this oil version. Will be repurchasing that one as the pigment on this is super light but also the color does not stay at all. A bit too sticky to use on the cheeks in my opinion.

reviews.headline: Love it! but gave me acne
reviews.comments: On my lips its amazing!! Its my absolute favorite and cant go anywhere without it! But on my cheeks :( not as good. Its sticky on the cheeks so my hair sticks to it and it gave me soooo much acne on my cheeks. Never had acne there until i started using this product. Better off buying the $8 version of it. Would recommend for lips but absolutely no for cheeks :/

reviews.headline: Perfect color and feel!
reviews.comments: Love this product!   Nice feel...not sticky at all.  Smooth and lasts great!

reviews.headline: I love it
reviews.comments:
Lips- I don't think it colored my lips as expected. I already have a pinker mouth, so maybe that's why it didn't pigment as much.
Cheek- I liked the application on the cheeks more because it gave the impression of health, not only because of the pinker color but also because of the glow

reviews.headline: Doesn't last and is sticky
reviews.comments:
Product doesnt last on cheeks or lips. You have to constantly reapply evrry 20 minutes. Cant reapply on cheeks because the more you do the more sticky it will be.
Just get the black honey lip gloss for a similiar and better effect.

reviews.headline: Good for cheeks, not so much for lips
reviews.comments:
For me, the planned main function of this product was for my lips. I've recently gotten into lip oils, and have used some great ones. I had really high hopes for this given it's Clinique, but I'm afraid it didn't live up to its' name. I really like the almost lipstick in black honey.
I would like to start by saying that this product works great for the cheeks. Use and blend-ability was great. It was pigmented sufficiently, and spread nicely around the cheek. It's a beautiful sheer color.
As for a lip oil, I put it on, put my lips together like normal, and then all the lip oil was lining my lips. The texture is too thin. Further, it was gone in 15-20 minutes, requiring a lot of reapplication. One would think that, if the lip oil was soaking in so fast, it would at least be good for the skin on my lips. Sadly, it was not. It was drying and my mid-day my lips were peeling from being chapped. 
Overall, I don't recommend this as a product for your lips given the detriments. I will keep it, but only use it on my cheeks.

reviews.headline: hardly visible on cheeks
reviews.comments: Looks great on the lips but I have brown skin and put it on my cheeks it completely disappears and it also leaves a sticky feeling since it's a lip oil but overall it's a pretty shade!

reviews.headline: Quantity is SO small
reviews.comments: I do like the cheek oil and color is great for me. BUT, there's so little in the bottle that it's almost comical. Way too expensive for how quickly I'll go through this.

media.headline: Pretty color, but sticky and overpriced
Please keep forever!
media.caption: One light layer on lips and leftover on cheeks

faceoff_positive.comments:
I am SO glad I bought this. I like the OG stick, I do not like the new gloss formula or shade variation of black honey, it's brown and dreary compared to the OG and the new lip oil. This is the BEST lip oil/gloss I have ever used! I love everything about it! It is NOT sticky whatsoever, is wears down evenly and does not get gooey in the corners of cakey on the lip line as so many glosses do. The depth of the color is dimensional, and is SO pretty. It allows your own color to show through AND has great pigmentation of it's own. Too many glosses or oils have little to no pigment. Now, CLINIQUE,    many of my favorite Clinique products have been discontinued, and there is NO replacing them. I am a product junkie and have a library of beauty awareness and knowledge to back this up. PLEASE, you MUST make this PERMANENT!!! And, if you really want to be wise for your own benefit and for the best of your customers, you also need to use this same formula and add OTHER COLORS. I do not buy your glosses, never have liked any formula of them. The short-lived matte lip in Cake was perfect but was killed. I like lip oils but most have little to no pigment. I do not wear clear gloss, I need COLOR. You need this in a Pink Honey, a Red Honey, a Nude Honey, and a Melon or Peach Honey. The packaging is great, and the product is THE BEST. PLEASE listen to the requests of your loyal customers. Years ago you had a color-extension of the OG Black Honey. They were great but not marketed well so they died. Your former cream eye shadows, both formulas, are still unable to be truly "replaced". The extensive color selections were super long-wearing, no creasing, highly-pigmented, and NO one else to date has anything like them. The cool shimmery pink, the cool shimmery violet, etc are not in any other line. Shadow sticks do not compare to these. 
Please make this permanent  add more shades to this exceptional formula!!!!
faceoff_positive.headline: Perfect lip oil!

faceoff_negative.comments:
[I received this product in exchange for my honest review]

For the lips, this was a cute, quick, very hydrating formula with just a hint of a tint that I'm looking for with that shine. The downside is that it will stay on a full two second before I've smacked it or licked it off (unknowingly.) The formula is a bit heavy, so I can just feel it there, and I unintentionally rub my lips together until it's all gone almost immediately. It is a shame because it is a very good product otherwise.

I'm not sure how I was supposed to use it for the cheeks, though. There were no directions on the packaging, and since I've never used a lip oil as a cheek product, I'm sure I wasn't doing it right, however, it was too sticky no matter how I used it. If I used it on top of foundation, it took off the foundation, and there's no way it's going under foundation. It seems like it should be used for natural skin maybe? The glow I got was absolutely DIVINE! But the color wasn't worth the oil residue that my hair kept getting sticking myself into.
faceoff_negative.headline: Great for the 2 seconds it was on. Not good for the cheeks.
